page.title: 03Beswick: People and Farming
page.content: Much of the land in this area is owned by the Lord Hotham, and managed by Hotham Estates. Many of the farmers are tenant farmers, their houses and farms, and associated farm-workers' cottages, belonging to the Hotham Estates. The three main farms in and around Beswick are managed by the Beachell, Duggleby and Spence families. Up to relatively recent times these farms would have provided employment for a substantial number of workers but with the availability of modern machinery very few men are required in addition to the farmer himself.In August 1985 61 men, women and children were living in Beswick, including 3 generations of two families. Of the total population less than one-third belongs to families involved in farming.
